p.ph: Implementation of PTP over OTN can be achieved by inserting and extracting PTP packets into user-defined locations of the OTN overhead via the device overhead insertion and extraction ports. The OTN Frame Pulse interface provides frame pulse signals that are synchronous to the frame alignment of OTN frames received by, or transmitted from, the device. An external PTP processor can use these frame pulses to determine the time PTP packets are received or sent via OTN overhead. Note that when the OTN framer for a given link is in an OOF state, the behavior of the frame pulse signals presented at the OTN Frame Pulse Interface is undefined.
